InstallData.Description: Descriptive text just for the administrator. Not used by the solution.
InstallData.InstallCommand: The installation command. Example: Invoke-AppDeployToolkit.exe Install
InstallData.UninstallCommand: The uninstallation command. Example: Invoke-AppDeployToolkit.exe Uninstall
InstallData.SetupFile: The file used to install the app. Example: Invoke-AppDeployToolkit.exe
InstallData.MaxRunTimeInMinutes: Integer value of maximum allowed time in minutes for the installation to complete. Default is 60 minutes.

General.ScopeTagName: Not yet implemented in the solution. Could be the scope tag name to be used for the app in the future.

DetectionAndRequirementRules.Description: Custom detection script. A Detection.ps1 file needs to be in the root folder of the app package. While requirement-scripts can be used in addition to other requirements. A detection script will replace all other detection rules.
Custom requirement script. A Requirement.ps1 file needs to be in the root folder of the app package.
DetectionAndRequirementRules.OperationType: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[string, dateTime, integer, float, version, boolean]. What kind of value is to be returned by the script. This makes sure Intune compares it correctly.
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Operator: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[equal, notEqual, greaterThan, greaterThanOrEqual, lessThan, lessThanOrEqual]
DetectionAndRequirementRules.ComparisonValue: Value to the compared against. Any custom value coming from the script will be compared against this value.

DetectionAndRequirementRules.Description: Registry value COMPARISON rule. Can be used to test values like versionnumbers for example. Can either be used as a detection or requirement rule
DetectionAndRequirementRules.OperationType: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[string, integer, version]. What kind of value is to be compared. This makes sure Intune compares it correctly.
DetectionAndRequirementRules.KeyPath: Registry path to be checked. Use double \ for path entries due to json format. Example: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\IntuneTools
DetectionAndRequirementRules.ValueName: Registry-Value to be checked. Example: DisplayVersion
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Operator: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[equal, notEqual, greaterThan, greaterThanOrEqual, lessThan, lessThanOrEqual]
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Value: Value to the compared against. Example: 1.0.0
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Check32BitOn64System: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[true, false]. Whether to check the 32-bit registry view on a 64-bit system.

DetectionAndRequirementRules.Description: Registry EXISTENCE rule. Can be used to test the existence of a registry entry. Can either be used as a detection or requirement rule
DetectionAndRequirementRules.OperationType: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[exists, doesNotExist]. Whether the registry value should exist or not.
DetectionAndRequirementRules.KeyPath: Registry path to be checked. Use double \ for path entries due to json format. Example: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\IntuneTools
DetectionAndRequirementRules.ValueName: Registry-Value to be checked. Example: DisplayVersion
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Value: Value needs to be empty for existence rules.
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Check32BitOn64System: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[true, false]. Whether to check the 32-bit registry view on a 64-bit system.

DetectionAndRequirementRules.Description: File or folder COMPARISON rule. Can be used to test values like versionnumbers for example. Can either be used as a detection or requirement rule
DetectionAndRequirementRules.OperationType: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[modifiedDate, createdDate, version, sizeInMB]. What kind of value is to be compared. This makes sure Intune compares it correctly.
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Path: Path to file or folder. Use double \ for path entries due to json format. Example: C:\Program Files\IntuneTools
DetectionAndRequirementRules.FileOrFolderName: Folder or filename like: BinariesFolder or IntuneTools.exe
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Operator: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[equal, notEqual, greaterThan, greaterThanOrEqual, lessThan, lessThanOrEqual]
DetectionAndRequirementRules.ComparisonValue: Value to the compared against. Example: 1.0.0
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Check32BitOn64System: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[true, false]. Whether to check the 32-bit file system redirection on a 64-bit system.

DetectionAndRequirementRules.Description: File or folder EXISTENCE rule. Can be used to test the existence of a file or folder. Can either be used as a detection or requirement rule
DetectionAndRequirementRules.OperationType: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[exists, doesNotExist]. Whether the file or folder should exist or not.
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Path: Path to file or folder. Use double \ for path entries due to json format. Example: C:\Program Files\IntuneTools
DetectionAndRequirementRules.FileOrFolderName: Folder or filename like: BinariesFolder or IntuneTools.exe
DetectionAndRequirementRules.ComparisonValue: Value needs to be empty for existence rules.
DetectionAndRequirementRules.Check32BitOn64System: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[true, false]. Whether to check the 32-bit file system redirection on a 64-bit system.

Assignments.Type: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[Test, Prod]. Not yet implemented in the solution. Intention was to have assignemts for testing and for production.
Assignments.Description: Description of the assignment. Just for documentation purposes for the administrator.
Assignments.GroupID: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[AllDevices, AllUsers or an Entra ID group object ID]. IMPORTANT: Be carefule when using AllDevices or AllUsers as it will assign the app to all users or devices in the tenant.
Assignments.GroupName: Name of the Entra ID group if a group is used. Not used, just for documentation purposes.
Assignments.UseLocalTime: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[true, false]. True meanst the local client time is used for scheduling. False means UTC time is used.
Assignments.FilterID: ID of an Intune filter to be used for the assignment. Not yet implemented in the solution.
Assignments.FilterMode: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[none, include, exclude]. Not yet implemented in the solution. New-IntuneWin32AppAssignment can use this as parameter -AssignmentFilterType
Assignments.AvailableTime: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[either nothing for -as soon as possible- or a datetime in ISO 8601 format like 2026-01-31T12:00:00Z].
Assignments.DeadlineTime: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[either nothing -as soon as possible- or a datetime in ISO 8601 format like 2026-01-31T12:00:00Z].
Assignments.DeliveryOptimizationPriority: POSSIBLE-VALUES:[notConfigured, foreground, background]. No need to change this normally. Leave it as notConfigured.
Assignments.EnableRestartGracePeriod: Not yet implemented in the solution.
Assignments.RestartGracePeriodInMinutes: Not yet implemented in the solution.
Assignments.RestartCountDownDisplayInMinutes: Not yet implemented in the solution.
Assignments.RestartNotificationSnoozeInMinutes: Not yet implemented in the solution.

Assignments.Description: Example assignment to a test group. Add as many assignments as needed.
